name: Grand Park Kunming

reviews.text: Large hotel about 25 or so minutes to and from airport; that is if the huge traffic jams are not so huge. If you are arriving or leaving during rush hour it may take longer . A new Airport is being built for Kunming, but this new airport will be a longer distance from the downtown area and will definitely take longer to get into the city.
reviews.title: Hotel is acceptable, but not 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large in this hotel and beds acceptable. Bed linens are clean and crisp. Carpet appears dirty and old. This hotel definitely shows wear. But, all in all not a bad place to stay. Bathroom is clean and amenities are OK. Nice TV with some English speaking channels. Staff were helpful, but do not speak a lot of English.
reviews.title: Good compromise

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is large with both Western and Chinese selections. Food is nicely displayed and a decent selection of fruit, bread, yogurt, eggs, etc.
reviews.title: Not cheap but worth the money

reviews.text: Traffic is Kunming is horrible during their rush hour. Our drivers were very good and they earned their tip money.
reviews.title: Connecting rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I enjoyed my stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Dated property and not much of service

reviews.text: 1 night stop over on our way to Mandalay. Would probably try sth else next time.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings: weird service, rest ok

reviews.text: Like: Big room, good bed, good location in walking distance to Green Lake, decent breakfast, at least some of the staff spoke some English
reviews.title: Hardly a luxury hotel
Consistently average
reviews.text: Unlike: arrived tired at 1.15 at night, had to wait 15 min for check-in due to 'system audit'; no water in the swimming pool, which nobody cared to mention at the reception even though I had asked them where the pool is - I ended up standing next to it in my swimming trunks with a pretty stupid face. No big issues, but stuff like that shouldn't happen in a 'five star' hotel (assigned by themselves?)

Check in was painfully slow with long queues and staff standing around watching, service style was abrupt and not welcoming in any way. Room on level 12 was very basic and quite shabby. Bed was ok, view was awful and hotel facilities very average.
reviews.title: 4 star....
Wait Until Renovations Are Finished
reviews.text: I am a regular guest here, 2 or 3 times per year since many years. It is a 4 star hotel with very average facilities and very average staff. It has a good location, near a nice inner city lake area. Good for a morning run or an evening walk. About 2 km circumference, a bit crowded, but lively. The altitude (1800m) is not encouraging for strenuous exercise - maybe that's the reason why the gym is so unattractive and unused.

Perfectly adequate but little missteps make me hesitant to recommend this hotel. I stayed three nights in a club level room which includes the use of the club lounge. The club level room was not a larger room which I verified from a colleague who did not book a club level room. The club lounge was ok but because of my schedule I couldn't really take advantage of the limited hours they provided coffee and snacks. Mostly my fault I admit, but they could expand the hours of this service. The breakfast was ok but it was heavy on asian food. Again, we're in China but after living in China for a while, I sometimes regard a nicer hotel as an oasis for some passable western food. This hotel was not that oasis. The housekeeping was a little sub-standard. I ironed a shirt one morning and the board and iron remained up in the middle of my room for the rest of the stay. I drank some of the coffee provided in the room and it wasn't replaced. On the last day of my stay some fruit appeared in my room. No idea if this was supposed to have been there all along. Otherwise, the location is nice enough and the staff was generally accomodating.
reviews.title: Not bad but no polish

reviews.text: Great location (walking distance to Green Lake), Rooms were spacious and clean. Helpfulness of staff was mixed and not much English spoken. There were great restaurants that were walking distance (including Over The Bridge Noodles). It was easy to catch a taxi near the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location (walking distance to Green Lake), Rooms were spacious and clean.

reviews.text: We did not have a choice in booking our stay at this hotel as it was done for us through our adoption agency and because Kunming is the capital city of the Yunnan province, most families who adopt in Yunnan will stay here. However, it is comfortable, clean and very accommodating for new families and if we return to Kunming, I would stay here again. Front desk staff speaks English fluently which was a huge comfort even though we spoke a few simple Mandarin phrases, there was free in room internet, large and varied breakfast buffet, and clean room and bathroom. We spent five days in this room and we really lived in it. Having a new child and needing to bond we spent a lot of time playing on the bed, napping, looking out the windows and eating in the room. We did not have a guide and we do not speak Mandarin so we ventured mostly to Green Lake for a few hours to walk in the afternoon and people watch on the park benches, and then to the surrounding shopping district to pick up snacks daily in the evening. We were comfortable walking around after dark in the immediate neighborhood.
reviews.title: Comfortable standard room, good lakeside location

reviews.text: The hotel is dependable as long as you are not asking for much. Rooms are getting old but still functional and clean. Hotel staff are not proactively helpful but are responsive. Price is very competitive as compared to the green lake hotel nearby.
reviews.title: A dependable Hotel for Business Travelers

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for two days. This is one of the few hotels in Kunming, Yunnan that lives up to a five star international standard hotel. The room was nice and clean and definitely has no smell like other Chinese hotels. The service was very good. Jean He, a front desk duty manager had gone out of her way to help us with our purchase of an international sim card so we could call home. The hotel locates in a nice and quiet part of town, near a lake with lots of tea houses and western bars.
reviews.title: A true five star hotel in Kunming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had written a scathing review of this hotel as we were very angry at the standards here only on sober reflection I cancelled it. Lucky, as I then met the manager in the lift and he took time out to explain why it was so run down and what plans they had to improve it and take it to the standards that should be expected.
reviews.title: Second attempt
Great location
reviews.text: They are modernising it floor by floor and the renovations are good and will make a difference. Eventually. However, we cannot let him off the hook totally. Firstly, they are a long way off completion and some work needs to be done immediately on customer service which is so so bad here. It is that which had set us off in the first place. The staff here are so bad, so dreadful, the worst we have faced anywhere at an expensive hotel. Even in China.

They were incapable of getting us a taxi. On two occasions. Often, there was absolutely no one there when guests arrived laden with luggage. The service in the rooftop bar was unbelievably bad. Quite laughable and they hadn't heard of a gin and tonic and all soft drinks were warm because they hadn't switched on the fridge - to save electricity we were told.
reviews.title: Will return to this hotel..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was okay and the rooms though very dingy (at the moment) were actually very comfortable with good beds. However, not only do the rooms need modernising but the corridors are dingy places.
reviews.title: A gem on the lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This will be a big job but with big hotel chains moving in soon into this beautiful city, I suggest that they need to move very fast.
reviews.title: Excellent stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms were ok, maybe a little dated, but service wasn't great given that a number of foreigners stay there
reviews.title: ok hotel but don't expect 5-star service

reviews.text: has effort to be an international hotel
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Kunming

reviews.text: This may be at the moment the only Hotel in Kunming that belongs to an International chain, so this is something that it will be very important if you spend many days in China. Room is not new, but acceptable. Only the bathroom was so-so as it was the old style and the tub curtain was already dirty, so not too nice.
reviews.title: Basic and not five stars

reviews.text: However English communication with the staff was never a problem and this is something that could be very important when you travel in China. Breakfast was quite good considering that in China many hotels do not have many western options for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you spend some money.
Good hotel, great location
reviews.text: Service was good and everybody seems to try to make you feel comfortable.

To be honest this hotel is a bit dated. The lobby is all chandeliers and splendor but looks old fashioned, the rooms have small TVs in big wooden cases, the pool is an odd shape that is neither family friendly nor set up for serious swimmers, and the gym feels like at a time it could have been considered cutting edge but that time was not in the recent past.
reviews.title: A walk in the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However once you get over this it is all good news! Great rooms with lovely towels and dressing gowns, helpful staff who checked us in and out efficiently and organised drivers to ferry us around. Weather permitting, there is a great little outside sunbathing area through the swimming pool changing rooms (although the outdoor Jacuzzi was broken when i stayed there).
reviews.title: Good Hotel, horrid, dirty traffic congested city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family also enjoyed sipping a G&T in the lobby while we were serenaded by a string quartet. Well, who wouldn't?!
reviews.title: One of my old favorites

reviews.text: Very smart comfortable hotel. Firm beds, spacious room and bathroom.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great food, great service

reviews.text: This offsets the location which just another high rise in a city of high rises.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel Stay
Grand hotel Kunming
reviews.text: Very good hotel. Front desk speaks acceptabel english and is helpfull.
Airline pilot myself and i would most certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Grand Park Hotel, Kunming, China

reviews.text: In a nice area within walkin distance of a lake.
reviews.title: Nothing more than a 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blue bird restaurant across the street and recommended highly. Didn't eat there because it was closed for Chinese newyear.
reviews.title: As expected

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and clean with an unlimited supply of bottled water. The staff is fantastic! One staff member that particularly stands out is Bestar. Thank you, Bestar! You helped make our trip a success!
reviews.title: Good choice for Kunming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a pleasant location a short walk from Cuihu Lake. Our room was quite large but not with a view of the lake and certainly not deluxe, as booked. The buffet in the evening was not of a very high standard, although the breakfast was reasonable.
reviews.title: Not really up to standard

reviews.text: Check out took over half an hour as their credit card terminals were not working properly. Despite having reserved almost the double amount at check in, they asked if we could pay in cash – only in yuan, as they did not accept dollars. Finally they managed to get a terminal to work. Not what one expects from an international four star hotel in a large city.
reviews.title: Excellent service from reservations to check in to departure. 5*Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights. Had many changes to my reservations as i couldnt firm up my travel plans. FAY Ye from reservation was an angel, helping me to change and assist in my every request, even helped me to some special arrangements, stepping out of the norm service levels.
reviews.title: Out of 8 cities and hotels in China, this was the worse.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a breeze, even with different arrival times with my wife, she didnt have any issues at all when arriving earlier than me.
reviews.title: Grand Park Hotel not far from Green Lake

reviews.text: Had a issue with the room, was rectified immediately.
reviews.title: Adoption trip

description: Centrally located and only a 20 minutes’ drive from Kunming International Airport and minutes from the Central Business District, the 300-room Grand Park Kunming is the first international luxury hotel in Kunming. With its undulating wave-like façade soaring 18 storeys above the lush green surroundings coupled with prime views of the famous Green Lake, the hotel is an iconic landmark set to pamper the modern international traveller.
